a.g: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Arrangement of Litanies
The first devotional period (Wird): what is between the rising of dawn (Fajr) and the rising of the sun, and it is a noble time, and its nobility and merit are indicated by Allah the Exalted swearing by it when He said: 'By the morning when it breathes' (Quran 81:18), and praising it when He said: 'The Cleaver of the dawn' (Quran 6:96), and He said: 'Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak"' (Quran 113:1), and His manifestation of power in the contraction of the shadow therein when He said: 'Then We withdraw it to Us a gradual withdrawal' (Quran 25:46), and it is the time of contracting the shadow of the night by spreading the light of the sun, and His guiding people to glorification (TasbÄ«á¸¥) therein by His saying: 'So exalt Allah when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning' (Quran 30:17), and by His saying: 'So exalt Allah with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting' (Quran 50:39), and His saying: 'And exalt Him during the night and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied' (Quran 20:130), and His saying: 'And remember the name of your Lord morning and evening' (Quran 76:25).

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Secrets of Prayer
Wednesday night: Fatimah (may Allah be pleased with her) narrated from the Prophet (peace be upon him) that he said: (Whoever prays on Wednesday night two units of prayer, recites in the first unit the Opening (Al-Fatihah) of the Book and 'Say: I seek refuge with the Lord of the Daybreak (Qul A'udhu bi-Rabb al-Falaq)' ten times, and in the second unit after the Opening (Al-Fatihah) 'Say: I seek refuge with the Lord of Mankind (Qul A'udhu bi-Rabb al-Nas)' ten times, then when he gives the salutation (Salam) he seeks forgiveness (Istighfar) from Allah ten times, then sends prayers (Salah) upon Muhammad (peace be upon him) ten times, seventy thousand angels descend from every heaven writing his reward until the Day of Resurrection (Yawm al-Qiyamah)[256]).

a.g: From the evil of that which He created
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Invocations and Supplications
I seek refuge in the complete words (Kalamat) of Allah and all His names from the evil (Sharr) of what He has created (Khalaqa) and brought forth, and from the evil of every possessor of evil, and from the evil of every creature (Dabbah) whose forelock You take hold of. Indeed, my Lord is on a straight path (Sirat Mustaqim). Abu al-Sheikh extracted it in the Book of Reward from the narration of Abd al-Rahman bin Awf: Whoever says when morning comes: 'I seek refuge in the complete words of Allah which no righteous or wicked person can surpass, from the evil of what He has created (Khalaqa) and brought forth and originated,' he is protected from the evil of the two weighty ones (Thaqalayn). In the narration: And if he says them when evening comes, it will be so for him until morning. And in it is Ibn Lahi'ah. And for Ahmad from the narration of Abd al-Rahman bin Hasan in the narration: Indeed, Gabriel said: O Muhammad, say: 'I seek refuge in the complete words of Allah from the evil of what He has created (Khalaqa) and originated and brought forth, and from the evil of what descends from the sky.' The narration, and its chain is good.

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Breaking the Two Desires
The second benefit: the preservation of progeny and the continuity of existence, this is its benefit. But in it are harms that destroy religion and the worldly life if it is not controlled, not subdued, and not returned to the limit of moderation. And it has been said in the interpretation of His saying, the Exalted, "Our Lord, do not burden us with what we have no strength for" its meaning is severe overpowering, and from Ibn Abbas: regarding His saying, the Exalted, "And from the evil of the darkening (ghÄsiq) when it enters (waqab)" he said: it is the rising of the male organ (al-dhikr). And some narrators attributed it to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) except that he said in its interpretation: the male organ (al-dhikr) when it enters. And it has been said: when the male organ (dhikr) of a man rises, two-thirds of his intellect goes away. And he (peace be upon him) used to say in his supplication "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the evil of my hearing and my sight and my heart (qalb) and my strength and my semen" and he (peace be upon him) said "Women are the snares of Satan and were it not for this desire, women would not have dominion over men."

ğŸ“– Vol 2: Etiquette of Marriage
And in the rare interpretations from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, regarding the meaning of His saying, the Exalted: 'And from the evil of the darkening (ghÄsiq) when it settles (waqab)' (Quran 113:3), he said: 'The rising of the male organ (dhakar).' And this is a dominant affliction when it surges; neither intellect nor religion can resist it. And although it is suitable to be an incentive for both lives as previously mentioned, it is the strongest tool of Satan against the children of Adam, and to this the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, alluded in his saying: 'I have not seen anyone more overpowering to men of understanding than you women.'[27] And that is only due to the agitation of desire.
